title: Ezekiel Chapter 10 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Ezekiel chapter 10 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Ezekiel Chapter 10 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Ezekiel Chapter 10.

questions.question: What appeared above the head of the cherubims as described in Ezekiel 10:1?
options: A sapphire stone like a throne
questions.correctAnswer: A sapphire stone like a throne
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:1 says there appeared over the cherubims as it were a sapphire stone, like the appearance of a throne.

questions.question: Who was instructed to take coals of fire from between the cherubims and scatter them over the city?
options: The spirit of the living creature
questions.correctAnswer: The man clothed with linen
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:2 tells how the man clothed with linen was commanded to take fire from between the cherubims and scatter it over the city.

questions.question: Where did the cherubims stand when the man clothed with linen went in?
options: On the right side of the house
On the left side of the house
questions.correctAnswer: On the right side of the house
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:3 states that the cherubims stood on the right side of the house when the man went in.

questions.question: What filled the house and the court as the glory of the LORD went up from the cherub?
questions.correctAnswer: A cloud and brightness
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:4 describes that the house was filled with cloud and the court with the brightness of the LORD's glory.

questions.question: The sound of the cherubims' wings was likened to what?
options: The voice of the Almighty God
The blowing of a mighty wind
questions.correctAnswer: The voice of the Almighty God
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:5 compares the sound of the cherubims' wings to the voice of the Almighty God when He speaks.

questions.question: What did one cherub do with the fire that was between the cherubims?
options: Stretched forth his hand and put fire into the man's hand
questions.correctAnswer: Stretched forth his hand and put fire into the man's hand
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:7 tells how one cherub stretched out his hand and took fire to give to the man clothed with linen.

questions.question: What was seen under the wings of the cherubims?
options: The form of a man's hand
questions.correctAnswer: The form of a man's hand
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:8 describes the appearance of a man's hand under the wings of the cherubims.

questions.question: How many wheels were by the cherubims, and what was their color?
options: Four wheels, color of a beryl stone
questions.correctAnswer: Four wheels, color of a beryl stone
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:9 states that there were four wheels by the cherubims, and their appearance was like the color of a beryl stone.

questions.question: How did the wheels move according to Ezekiel 10:11?
options: They went in the direction the head looked without turning as they went
They spun rapidly on their axis
They rolled only forward without turning
They moved randomly in all directions
questions.correctAnswer: They went in the direction the head looked without turning as they went
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:11 explains that the wheels turned to the place the head looked and did not turn as they went.

questions.question: True or False: Each of the cherubims had only one face.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:14 states that every cherub had four faces: cherub, man, lion, and eagle.

questions.question: True or False: The wheels beside the cherubims moved independently and separately from the cherubims.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:16 describes how the wheels went beside the cherubims and did not turn away from them when they lifted up.

questions.question: True or False: The glory of the LORD departed from the threshold of the house and stood over the cherubims.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:18 clearly states that the glory of the LORD departed from the threshold and stood over the cherubims.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Every cherub had four ______ apiece, and every one four wings.
questions.correctAnswer: faces
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:21 says every cherub had four faces apiece and every one four wings.

questions.question: What did the cherubims do as they lifted up their wings in Ezekiel 10:19?
options: They mounted up from the earth and went out
They scattered fire over the city
questions.correctAnswer: They mounted up from the earth and went out
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:19 describes the cherubims lifting their wings and mounting up from the earth as they went out.

questions.question: What was the likeness of the wheels as described in Ezekiel 10:10?
options: Like a wheel within a wheel
questions.correctAnswer: Like a wheel within a wheel
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:10 explains that the wheels had one likeness as if a wheel were in the midst of a wheel.

medium.title: Ezekiel Chapter 10 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Ezekiel Chapter 10 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does Ezekiel 10 teach us about trusting God's power when facing spiritual challenges?
options: God's glory fills the house and court, showing His overwhelming presence
We should rely on our own strength before seeking God's help
God remains silent during our trials to test our patience
We must avoid spiritual duties to escape challenges
questions.correctAnswer: God's glory fills the house and court, showing His overwhelming presence
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:4 describes the glory of the LORD filling the house and court, demonstrating God's powerful presence that encourages trust during challenges. Verses 5 and 18-19 also highlight God's glory and power clearly.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with obedience in difficult circumstances. Based on Ezekiel 10, what biblical truth would you share?
options: Obedience to God's commands brings involvement in His divine plan
Obedience is optional if circumstances are hard
God only requires obedience from leaders, not all believers
Obedience is only about outward actions, not the heart
questions.correctAnswer: Obedience to God's commands brings involvement in His divine plan
questions.explanation: In Ezekiel 10:2-3, the man clothed with linen obeys the command to take fire and scatter it over the city, showing that obedience connects us to God's purposes. Verses 6-7 also reinforce this obedience under God's direction.

questions.question: How can the imagery of the cherubim's wings and eyes inspire personal spiritual discipline?
options: It reminds us to be watchful and diligent in spiritual matters
It suggests that only angels are responsible for spiritual discipline
It teaches that physical strength is more important than spiritual alertness
It indicates that spiritual discipline requires isolation from others
questions.correctAnswer: It reminds us to be watchful and diligent in spiritual matters
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:12 describes the wheels and cherubim full of eyes, symbolizing watchfulness. This encourages believers to be spiritually vigilant and disciplined. Verses 5 and 21 emphasize the attentive nature needed in spiritual life.

questions.question: What does the vision of the four faces of the cherubim teach about humility and contentment in serving God?
options: Each face represents different qualities, teaching us to serve God humbly with diverse gifts
It shows that only one type of service is acceptable to God
The faces represent pride and dominance over others
It implies that visible status is necessary for serving God
questions.correctAnswer: Each face represents different qualities, teaching us to serve God humbly with diverse gifts
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:14 and 10:21 state that each cherub had four faces (cherub, man, lion, eagle), symbolizing various attributes. This encourages humility and contentment in serving God with whatever gifts we have.

questions.question: A believer wants to understand how to persevere through trials. What insight does Ezekiel 10 offer?
options: The spirit of the living creatures moves with them, signifying God's sustaining presence
Trials indicate that God has abandoned us
Perseverance is unnecessary if we feel weak
Trials should be avoided at all costs
questions.correctAnswer: The spirit of the living creatures moves with them, signifying God's sustaining presence
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:17 shows the cherubim and wheels moving together because the spirit of the living creatures was in them, illustrating God's sustaining presence during trials. Verses 18-19 also highlight God's glory with them.

questions.question: How does Ezekiel 10 encourage believers to have integrity in their daily work and service?
options: By showing the man clothed in linen faithfully carrying out God's commands
By focusing only on personal gain rather than God's instructions
By ignoring God's message in favor of human wisdom
By avoiding responsibilities that seem difficult
questions.correctAnswer: By showing the man clothed in linen faithfully carrying out God's commands
questions.explanation: In Ezekiel 10:2-7, the man clothed with linen obeys God’s command perfectly, demonstrating integrity and faithfulness in service which believers should emulate.

questions.question: True or False: The wheels described in Ezekiel 10 turned independently of the cherubim when they moved.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:16 states that when the cherubim lifted their wings, the wheels did not turn away from beside them, showing they moved together in unity.

questions.question: True or False: The sound of the cherubim's wings was compared to the voice of the Almighty God speaking.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:5 clearly states that the sound of the cherubim's wings was heard as the voice of the Almighty God when He speaks, emphasizing God's majestic power.

questions.question: How does Ezekiel 10 guide believers in practicing generosity and stewardship?
options: By showing that God's fire is taken and scattered over the city as a sign of purification and judgment
By teaching that possessions are meant to be hoarded
By encouraging believers to keep blessings to themselves
By instructing to neglect God’s commands in favor of personal gain
questions.correctAnswer: By showing that God's fire is taken and scattered over the city as a sign of purification and judgment
questions.explanation: In Ezekiel 10:2-7, fire is taken from between the cherubim and scattered, symbolizing God's purifying action. This teaches believers about the seriousness of stewardship and the need for generosity aligned with God's holiness.

questions.question: How does the vision of the throne above the cherubim (Ezekiel 10:1) inspire personal devotion and prayer?
options: It reminds us that God is exalted and worthy of our worship and constant communion
It suggests that prayer is only for priests and prophets
It implies that prayer is unnecessary because God is distant
It encourages us to focus only on material needs in prayer
questions.correctAnswer: It reminds us that God is exalted and worthy of our worship and constant communion
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:1 describes a throne above the cherubim, symbolizing God's exalted position and majesty, encouraging believers to devote themselves to worship and prayer.

questions.question: Based on Ezekiel 10, what biblical principle can be learned about forgiveness and reconciliation in the church family?
options: God’s glory departs when there is disobedience, so restoration requires repentance and obedience
Forgiveness is unnecessary if offenses are minor
Reconciliation can be postponed indefinitely without consequence
God’s presence is unaffected by the behavior of His people
questions.correctAnswer: God’s glory departs when there is disobedience, so restoration requires repentance and obedience
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:18 shows the glory of the LORD departing from the threshold of the house, indicating God's displeasure with disobedience. Restoration of His presence requires repentance, teaching the need for forgiveness and reconciliation.

questions.question: How does Ezekiel 10 illustrate the importance of humility when serving in the church?
options: The man clothed in linen acts according to God's command without seeking glory
The cherubim demand honor and attention for themselves
Humility is not mentioned or modeled in this chapter
Only leaders are called to humility, not all believers
questions.correctAnswer: The man clothed in linen acts according to God's command without seeking glory
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:2-7 shows a man clothed in linen fulfilling God's instructions humbly and faithfully, teaching believers to serve without seeking personal recognition.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The wheels that accompanied the cherubim had the appearance and color of a ______ stone.
questions.correctAnswer: beryl
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:9 describes the wheels by the cherubim as having the appearance and color of a beryl stone, symbolizing their precious and dazzling nature.

questions.question: How can Ezekiel 10 encourage believers to persevere in prayer and spiritual warfare?
options: By showing the man clothed with linen actively participating in God's judgment
By suggesting that prayer is ineffective in spiritual battles
By advising believers to avoid confronting sin
By discouraging engagement in God’s plans
questions.correctAnswer: By showing the man clothed with linen actively participating in God's judgment
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:2-7 reveals the man clothed with linen obeying God's command to take fire and scatter it, illustrating active participation in God's spiritual work, encouraging perseverance in prayer and spiritual engagement.

questions.question: What lesson about faithfulness in serving others can be drawn from the cherubim and wheels moving in perfect unity?
options: Faithfulness requires harmony and cooperation in fulfilling God's purposes
Service is a solitary task with no need for unity
Faithfulness depends on personal ambition over teamwork
Unity is not necessary for effective service
questions.correctAnswer: Faithfulness requires harmony and cooperation in fulfilling God's purposes
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:16-17 describes the cherubim and wheels moving together because the spirit was in them, symbolizing the importance of unity and cooperation in faithful service.

hard.title: Ezekiel Chapter 10 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Ezekiel Chapter 10.

questions.question: What precious stone is described as appearing above the cherubims, resembling a throne?
questions.correctAnswer: Sapphire
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:1 states that above the cherubims appeared something like a sapphire stone resembling a throne, symbolizing divine majesty and heavenly authority.

questions.question: Who is commanded to take coals of fire from between the cherubims and scatter them over the city?
questions.correctAnswer: The man clothed with linen
questions.explanation: In Ezekiel 10:2, the command is given to the man clothed with linen to take fire from between the cherubims and scatter it over the city, symbolizing judgment.

questions.question: The sound of the cherubims' wings is compared to what in Ezekiel 10?
options: The voice of the Almighty God
questions.correctAnswer: The voice of the Almighty God
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:5 describes the sound of the cherubims' wings as being like the voice of the Almighty God when He speaks, emphasizing divine power.

questions.question: What is the color of the wheels beside the cherubims described as?
questions.correctAnswer: Beryl stone
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:9 states that the wheels beside the cherubims appeared as the color of a beryl stone, a precious greenish-blue gem indicating divine presence.

questions.question: What unique feature do the wheels beside the cherubims have according to Ezekiel 10?
questions.correctAnswer: A wheel within a wheel
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:10 describes the wheels as having one likeness, appearing as if a wheel was within a wheel, signifying complex divine mobility.

questions.question: How do the wheels move in relation to the direction of the cherubims?
options: They follow the direction the head looks without turning
They turn independently of the cherubims
questions.correctAnswer: They follow the direction the head looks without turning
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:11 explains that the wheels go in the direction the head looks without turning as they move, symbolizing perfect divine guidance.

questions.question: What is the significance of the eyes found on the wheels and the cherubims?
options: They symbolize divine omniscience and awareness
They represent the tribes of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: They symbolize divine omniscience and awareness
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:12 mentions eyes all around the cherubims and wheels, symbolizing God’s all-seeing nature and knowledge.

questions.question: Each cherub has how many faces and what are they?
questions.correctAnswer: Four: cherub, man, lion, eagle
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:14 specifies each cherub having four faces: cherub, man, lion, and eagle, representing multifaceted divine attributes.

questions.question: True or False: The cherubims described in Ezekiel 10 are the same living creatures Ezekiel saw by the river of Chebar.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:15 and 10:20 confirm that the cherubims seen here are the same living creatures Ezekiel saw by the river of Chebar, connecting visions.

questions.question: What action did the cherubims perform before the glory of the LORD departed from the house?
options: They lifted up their wings and mounted up from the earth
They scattered fire over the city
They spoke in a loud voice
questions.correctAnswer: They lifted up their wings and mounted up from the earth
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:19 describes the cherubims lifting their wings and mounting up from the earth before the glory of the LORD departed, symbolizing divine withdrawal.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The man clothed with linen took fire from between the _____ and went out.
questions.correctAnswer: cherubims
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:7 shows that the man clothed with linen took fire from between the cherubims, indicating the source of the purifying or punishing fire.

questions.question: What is the parallel between the cherubims in Ezekiel 10 and the living creatures in Revelation 4?
options: Both have four faces: lion, ox, man, and eagle
Both are described only as wheels
Both are described as angels of destruction only
questions.correctAnswer: Both have four faces: lion, ox, man, and eagle
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:14 and Revelation 4:7 share a typology of living creatures with four faces symbolizing creation’s fullness, indicating intertextual continuity.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 10, what does the 'likeness of a man's hand' under the wings of the cherubims symbolize in the ancient Near Eastern context?
questions.correctAnswer: Divine action or intervention
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:8 and 10:21 mention the likeness of a man's hand under the wings, commonly symbolizing God’s active intervention in the world in Hebrew imagery.

questions.question: What literary device is employed in Ezekiel 10:10 by describing the wheels as 'a wheel within a wheel'?
options: Chiasm to illustrate complexity and interconnection
questions.correctAnswer: Chiasm to illustrate complexity and interconnection
questions.explanation: The phrase 'wheel within a wheel' in Ezekiel 10:10 uses a chiasm-like structure symbolizing complexity and divine omnipresence and mobility, a common literary device in prophetic visions.

questions.question: Which theme predominant in Ezekiel 10 is also developed in later prophetic books such as Isaiah and Daniel?
options: The departure of God's glory indicating judgment and exile
The establishment of a new priesthood
questions.correctAnswer: The departure of God's glory indicating judgment and exile
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:18-19 shows God's glory departing the temple, a theme of divine judgment and exile also echoed in Isaiah 6 and Daniel's visions.

theological.title: Ezekiel Chapter 10 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Ezekiel Chapter 10 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What does the appearance of a sapphire stone above the cherubims symbolize in Ezekiel 10:1?
options: The divine throne and God's sovereign majesty
questions.correctAnswer: The divine throne and God's sovereign majesty
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:1 describes a sapphire-like throne above the cherubims, symbolizing God's majestic sovereign presence. This imagery aligns with God's throne in Isaiah 6:1, Revelation 4:6-7, and Psalm 99:1, emphasizing divine authority and holiness.

questions.question: Who is commanded to take coals of fire from between the cherubims and scatter them over the city?
questions.correctAnswer: The man clothed with linen
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:2 and 10:6-7 describe the man clothed with linen being commanded to take fire from between the cherubims and scatter it over the city, symbolizing divine judgment or purification. This role parallels the angelic agents in Exodus 25:10-22 and the angel of the Lord in Acts 12:7.

questions.question: What does the glory of the LORD doing in Ezekiel 10:4 signify?
options: God's presence departing from the temple threshold
questions.correctAnswer: God's presence departing from the temple threshold
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:4 indicates the glory of the LORD moving from the cherub to the threshold of the house, symbolizing God's imminent departure from the temple due to Israel's sin, a theme echoed in Ezekiel 11:22-23, Psalm 78:60, and 2 Chronicles 7:1-3.

questions.question: What is the significance of the sound of the cherubims' wings being like the voice of the Almighty God?
options: It reveals God's power and presence
It signifies the silence of heaven
It marks the end of prophecy
questions.correctAnswer: It reveals God's power and presence
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:5 compares the sound of cherubim wings to God's voice, emphasizing divine majesty and power. Similar descriptions appear in Ezekiel 1:24, Psalm 29:4, and Revelation 4:5, reinforcing God's awe-inspiring presence.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The four wheels beside the cherubims had the appearance of the color of a _____ stone.
questions.correctAnswer: beryl
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:9 describes the wheels as having the color of a beryl stone, a precious gem indicating purity and divine craftsmanship, consistent with the use of precious stones in God's throne imagery (Exodus 28:17-20; Revelation 21:19).

questions.question: What unique feature did the wheels beside each cherub have according to Ezekiel 10:10?
questions.correctAnswer: A wheel within a wheel
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:10 describes the wheels as having a likeness of a wheel within a wheel, symbolizing complex divine mobility and omnidirectional movement, paralleling Ezekiel 1:16 and Revelation 4:6, illustrating God's sovereign control over creation.

questions.question: How did the wheels move according to Ezekiel 10:11?
options: They moved in the direction the cherub's head faced without turning
They turned only to the right
questions.correctAnswer: They moved in the direction the cherub's head faced without turning
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:11 states the wheels moved straight in the direction the cherub's head faced without turning, symbolizing God's purposeful, unerring guidance. This is consistent with Isaiah 46:10 and Proverbs 16:9 emphasizing divine sovereignty.

questions.question: What was unique about the bodies, wings, hands, and wheels of the cherubims in Ezekiel 10:12?
options: They were full of eyes all around
questions.correctAnswer: They were full of eyes all around
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:12 describes the cherubims and their wheels as full of eyes all around, symbolizing God's omniscience and vigilance, a theme echoed in Revelation 4:6-8 and Daniel 10:6, emphasizing divine awareness of all things.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT one of the four faces each cherub had according to Ezekiel 10:14?
questions.correctAnswer: Serpent
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:14 lists the four faces as cherub, man, lion, and eagle; serpent is not included, distinguishing these holy creatures from the serpent imagery in Genesis 3 and Revelation 12, where the serpent symbolizes evil.

questions.question: How do the cherubims and wheels relate in their movements as described in Ezekiel 10:16?
options: The wheels move beside the cherubims and do not turn away from them
The wheels move independently of the cherubims
The cherubims move only when the wheels stop
The wheels spin while the cherubims remain still
questions.correctAnswer: The wheels move beside the cherubims and do not turn away from them
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:16 explains the wheels accompany the cherubims and do not turn away, illustrating unity of purpose and divine guidance, consistent with the unity of the Godhead’s actions (John 5:19; Psalm 104:4).

questions.question: What is the theological significance of the cherubims being 'living creatures' as stated in Ezekiel 10:15 and 10:20?
options: They symbolize God's dynamic and living presence among His people
They are mere statues without life
questions.correctAnswer: They symbolize God's dynamic and living presence among His people
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:15 and 10:20 refer to cherubims as living creatures, emphasizing God's active, living presence. This aligns with Revelation 4:6-8 and Genesis 3:24 where cherubims guard holiness, underscoring God's holiness and life-giving power.

questions.question: What happened to the glory of the LORD in Ezekiel 10:18?
options: It departed from off the threshold of the house and stood over the cherubims
It remained stationary above the temple altar
It descended into the temple's holy of holies
It vanished completely from the vision
questions.correctAnswer: It departed from off the threshold of the house and stood over the cherubims
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:18 records the glory of the LORD leaving the temple threshold and standing over the cherubims, symbolizing God's withdrawal from the temple due to Israel's sin, consistent with Ezekiel 11:22-23 and Jeremiah 7:12-15.

questions.question: Where did the cherubims and wheels stand after lifting up their wings and mounting up according to Ezekiel 10:19?
options: At the door of the east gate of the LORD's house
questions.correctAnswer: At the door of the east gate of the LORD's house
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:19 describes the cherubims and wheels standing at the east gate of the LORD’s house after mounting up, marking the threshold of God's departure and judgment, related to Ezekiel 9:3-4 and Zechariah 14:4 emphasizing God's presence and eschatological visitation.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 10:21, what combination of features did each cherub possess?
options: Four faces, four wings, and the likeness of the hands of a man under their wings
Two faces, two wings, and claws like an eagle
One face, six wings, and a lion's tail
Three faces, two wings, and a serpent's tongue
questions.correctAnswer: Four faces, four wings, and the likeness of the hands of a man under their wings
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 10:21 describes each cherub as having four faces, four wings, and human-like hands under their wings, demonstrating the combination of divine strength, intelligence, and human agency, similar to the vision in Ezekiel 1:6 and Revelation 4:7.

questions.question: What does the imagery of eyes all around the cherubims and their wheels teach about God's nature?
questions.correctAnswer: God is omniscient and all-seeing
questions.explanation: The eyes all around described in Ezekiel 10:12 symbolize God's omniscience, consistent with Job 28:24, Psalm 33:13-15, and Hebrews 4:13, affirming God perceives all actions and thoughts.
